DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To investigate relationship different policy realimentation ( early oral feeding versus traditional feeding ) length hospital stay follow laparotomy patient gynecologic oncologic disease . - To assess degree postoperative abdominal pain patient . - To evaluate incidence ileus symptom , include nausea vomiting , postoperative recovery intestinal activity patient . - To determine incidence postoperative complication patient . - To elucidate global postoperative patient 's satisfaction quality life group patient . OUTLINE : Patients stratify accord laparotomy without intestinal resection ( yes v ) , presence ovarian cancer ( yes v ) . Patients randomize 1 2 group end surgery . - Group 1 ( early feeding ) : Patients offer liquid diet day 1 24 hour follow surgery . Beginning day 2 , patient tolerate liquid diet offer regular diet hospital discharge . - Group 2 ( traditional feeding ) : Patients offer nothing mouth day 1 2 follow surgery . Beginning day 3 , patient offer liquid diet 24 hour . Beginning day 4 , patient tolerate liquid diet ( i.e. , nausea vomit ) offer semi-solid diet 24 hour . Beginning day 5 , patient tolerate semi-solid diet offer light regular diet hospital discharge . Data collect Post-Operative Pain Questionnaire , Bowel Function Table , Global Postoperative Patient 's Satisfaction Questionnaire , Postoperative Complication Hospital Stay Questionnaire , Quality Life Questionnaires EORTC OV-28 EORTC QLQ-C30 .
